io.vertx.core.spi.metrics

Interface PoolMetrics<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Metrics

    public interface PoolMetrics<T>
extends Metrics
    An SPI used internally by Vert.x to gather metrics on pools used by Vert.x (execute blocking, worker verticle or data source).

    Usually these metrics measure the latency of a task queuing and the latency a task execution.

    Author:
    Clement Escoffier

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface io.vertx.core.spi.metrics.Metrics

        DISABLE_METRICS_PROPERTY_NAME, METRICS_ENABLED

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default T begin(T t)
      The submitted task start to use the resource.
      default void end(T t, boolean succeeded)
      The submitted tasks has completed its execution and release the resource.
      default void rejected(T t)
      The task has been rejected.
      default T submitted()
      A new task has been submitted to access the resource.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.vertx.core.spi.metrics.Metrics

        close

    • Method Detail

      • submitted

        default T submitted()
        A new task has been submitted to access the resource. This method is called from the submitter context.
        Returns:
        the timer measuring the task queuing

      • begin

        default T begin(T t)
        The submitted task start to use the resource.
        Parameters:
        t - the timer measuring the task queuing returned by submitted()
        Returns:
        the timer measuring the task execution

      • rejected

        default void rejected(T t)
        The task has been rejected. The underlying resource has probably be shutdown.
        Parameters:
        t - the timer measuring the task queuing returned by submitted()

      • end

        default void end(T t,
                 boolean succeeded)
        The submitted tasks has completed its execution and release the resource.
        Parameters:
        succeeded - whether or not the task has gracefully completed
        t - the timer measuring the task execution returned by begin(T)
